titlestmt.titleproper: Preliminary Inventory to the Clarence Clemens Clendenen Papers, 1881-1968
titlestmt.author: Hoover Institution Archives Staff; machine-readable finding aid created by Xiuzhi Zhou

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-11-18T15:24-0800

change.item: Descriptions of reformatted audiovisual items updated, photocard file info added

did.unittitle: Clarence Clemens Clendenen Papers

physdesc.extent: 21 manuscript boxes, 4 card file boxes, 7 envelopes, 9 phonotapes

did.abstract: Printed matter, biographical notes, interviews, diaries, correspondence, army manuals, research notes, photographs, and maps, relating to American military history, especially during World War II and the Vietnamese War, and to the Punitive Expedition in Mexico in 1916.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Clarence Clemens Clendenen Papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

Clovis Ethelbert Byers undated speech about military chaplins

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Major General C. E. Byers recalls the history and importance of chaplains in the United States military. He speaks about experiences of the country from the revolution through World War II and the Korean conflict.

did.unittitle: Colonel Clarence C. Clendenen interviews Major General William Ord Ryan

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Interview with Major General William Ord Ryan, U. S. Air Force, Retired, concerning his experiences as a lieutenant in the 7th cavalry, in the Punitive Expedition of 1916, and further remarks on his military career.
Interviewer is Col. Clarence C. Clendenen as stated in his letter to Fraur Lanner, Oct. 10, 1974.

did.unittitle: Confession of Librado Saenz Pardo Martinez and interview with Colonel Merlin J. Chadey

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Confession of Librado Saenz Pardo Martinez, assassin of Pancho Villa. Recorded 10/3/57 by William V. Morrison of El Paso, Texas
Colonel Merlin J. Chadsey, retired cavalry - recorded at Fort Union, National Mon by Homer Hasting, June 64.

did.unittitle: Interview with Major Walter Estes

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Interview with Major Walter Estes, retired Calvary Officer, recorded by the Fort Union National Monument, 1964

did.unittitle: Photographs
118 photos concerning Clendenden's attendance to West Point and the Cavalry School,

scopecontent.p: Includes portraits of his classmates, graduation ceremonies and his participation in many equestrian events.

did.unittitle: 65 photos and 61 negatives of the Punitive,
Expedition to Mexico, including photos of Villa, Obregon and U.S. Infantry,
26 photos of Colonel Clarence C. Clendenen's stay in Japan concerning the 1st Cavalry Division, the International War Crimes Commission and many tourist attractions,
Album containing 125 photos of Colonel Clarence C. Clendenen's stay in Japan relating to War Crimes Commission and travel photos,
15 photos of Colonel Clendenen in Michigan State College, South Dakota State College, St. John's University and the University of Iowa in which he was the head of the R.O.T.C. programs,
13 photos of the Negrito barrios in the Philippines where he was stationed,
96 miscellaneous personal and military photos,
10 miscellaneous photos
4 miscellaneous photos,
